intro: Bulbine bulbosa, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the genus Bulbine in the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. The plant features succulent, fleshy leaves that are often bluish-green in color. Its showy, tubular flowers are typically yellow or orange, with a prominent central spike. Bulbine bulbosa is well adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
